page.title: 02Historic Building in Bervie
page.content: Overlooking Bervie Bay is Hallgreen Castle standing in four acres of ground. The present owner who found it in a ruined state hopes to restore it to the original L plan house. During the renovations the owner happened to touch a wall in the vaulted kitchen. Part of it fell at his feet and there was{a narrow {spiral staircase which leads to the {Great Hall.} Other interesting finds were the Great Door, a marriage stone - "WR/HC 1687", gun loops and arrow slits for this castle was originally built in the { {fourteenth century}as a fortification. Much repair work has still to be done to this interesting castle which, like most others, is said to have a ghost - {The Green Lady.}
